metadata.title: Altiverruca Beringiana sp. n. (Crustacea, Cirripedia): First Record of Verrucomorphan Barnacle in the North Pacific

creators.name: Moscow State University, Dept. Invertebr. Zool., Fac. Biol

metadata.description:
In bottom samples gathered in the vicinity of Bering Island by R/V Mstislav
     Keldysh during its 22nd voyage, several specimens of Verrucomorpha were
     found belonging to a new species Altiverruca beringiana sp. n. The new
     species resembles A. sculpturata Zevina. Before this find, the verrucomorph
     cirripeds were never known about the 30 degree N latitude in the boreal
     Pacific. Taking into account earlier data, it can be assumed that the distribution
     area of this suborder of Cirripedia includes the entire World Ocean.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: A report on the Altiverruca beringiana sp. n. (Crustacea, Cirripedia): First record of verrucomorphan barnacle in the North Pacific
